level.text: The District of Columbia shall retain legal title to tools, equipment, and supplies provided as part of an individual’s rehabilitation program, except as provided in ยง 125.3.
An individual shall return goods provided by the Rehabilitation Services Administration if:
Requested by the Rehabilitation Services Administration;
The goods are no longer needed for the individual’s vocational rehabilitation program or independent living program; or

The individual is no longer participating in the vocational rehabilitation or independent living program, as agreed to and specified in the individual’s signed loaner equipment agreement, Individualized Plan for Employment (IPE), or Independent Living Plan (ILP).
The Rehabilitation Services Administration may assign the eligible individual title to the following:
Medical appliances not transferable to or useable by another person;
Goods provided as part of a business plan that was approved with the understanding that the goods would be used as collateral to leverage funds for the business; and
Devices or technologies that are associated with the client’s disability or are required for the client to maintain the employment outcome.
